name: cesare
params: setvar s0, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2

body.origin:
|- wal(s0, wi(w0, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w2, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w0, w2))

cumulated.origin:
|- wal(s0, wi(w0, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w2, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w0, w2))

stmt.origin: ax-mp(wal(s0, wi(w2, wn(w1))), wal(s0, wi(w1, wn(w2))))

body.origin:
|- wal(s0, wi(w2, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w1, wn(w2)))
-| wi(wal(s0, wi(w1, wn(w2))), wal(s0, wi(w2, wn(w1))))

cumulated.origin:
|- wal(s0, wi(w0, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w0, w2))
-| wal(s0, wi(w1, wn(w2)))
-| wi(wal(s0, wi(w1, wn(w2))), wal(s0, wi(w2, wn(w1))))

body.origin:
|- wi(wal(s0, wi(w1, wn(w2))), wal(s0, wi(w2, wn(w1))))
-| wi(wi(w1, wn(w2)), wi(w2, wn(w1)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wal(s0, wi(w0, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w0, w2))
-| wal(s0, wi(w1, wn(w2)))
-| wi(wi(w1, wn(w2)), wi(w2, wn(w1)))

|- wal(s0, wi(w0, wn(w1)))
-| wal(s0, wi(w0, w2))
-| wal(s0, wi(w1, wn(w2)))

comment: "Cesare", one of the syllogisms of Aristotelian logic. No ` ph ` is ` ps ` , and all ` ch ` is ` ps ` , therefore no ` ch ` is ` ph ` . In Aristotelian notation, EAE-2: PeM and SaM therefore SeP. Related to ~ celarent . (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 27-Aug-2016.) Reduce dependencies on axioms. (Revised by BJ, 16-Sep-2022.)
